abstract: A coming history of Google tells of the giant company’s mistakes in China and its failure to move quickly on social networking.
snippet: A coming history of Google tells of the giant company’s mistakes in China and its failure to move quickly on social networking.
lead_paragraph: When Google opened for business in China in 2006, Eric E. Schmidt, its chief executive, said, “Google has 5,000 years of patience in China.” But its divorce from the country just four years later was inevitable because operations there were troubled from the start.

headline.main: New Book on Google Shows Gaffes in China
headline.print_headline: New Book On Google Shows Gaffes In China
